person.persName: Joshua Tevis (Louisville, KY, State Rep & US District Atto, Col 10th Ky Cav (USA))

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney, politician, and soldier. Shelbyville, Kentucky, native. Married to Miriam E. Carter Tevis in Woodford County, Kentucky, on November 20, 1851. Father of Carter Tevis and Samuel Tevis. Studied law at the University of Louisville. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Shelby County from 1855 to 1857. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Jefferson County from 1859 to 1863. Attorney in Louisville in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment as colonel from September 10, 1862, to November 17, 1862. United States district attorney in Louisville from 1863 to 1866.
